title: Mushroom Sauce (Waldpilzsauce)
ingredients: 4 tablespoons (½ stick) unsalted butter or margarine
1 medium-size yellow onion, peeled and coarsely chopped
¾ pound chanterelles or boletus mushrooms; (or cultivated white mushrooms) wiped
clean with a damp cloth, stemmed and thinly sliced
½ teaspoon dried leaf marjoram, crumbled
¼ teaspoon dried leaf thyme, crumbled
⅛ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Melt the butter in a heavy 12-inch skillet over moderate heat.  Add the onion and sauté for 5 minutes, stirring constantly, until the onion is limp and golden.  Add the mushrooms, marjoram, thyme, and nutmeg and continue sautéing for 5 more minutes; again stirring constantly, until the mushrooms have released their juices and the juices have evaporated.  Sprinkle the flour into the skillet and cook and stir for 1 minute.  Pour in the beef broth, milk, and cream and cook 5 minutes, stirring constantly, until the sauce is thickened and no raw taste of flour remains.  Lastly, mix in the salt and pepper, taste it and adjust as needed.  Serve at once.
remarks: Serve over beef, but is excellent over noodles, potatoes, or even rice.
source: The New German Cookbook by Jean Anderson and Hedy Würz published by Harper Collins Publishers, © 1993 by Jean Anderson and Hedy Würz.
